meanings.definition: The marks used in writing to separate sentences, clauses, etc.
meanings.sent1: I always remember to use punctuations like periods and commas in my writing.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reminded us to check our punctuations before submitting the essay.
meanings.sent3: The story had so many punctuations that it looked like a colorful painting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a punctuation in the dull room, brightening everything up.
meanings.sent5: The lack of punctuations made the text confusing and hard to read.

meanings.definition: The act or practice of inserting standardized marks in written matter to clarify meaning.
meanings.sent1: Proper punctuations help readers understand the message clearly.
meanings.sent2: She studied the rules of punctuations to improve her writing skills.
meanings.sent3: The punctuations in the document were like signposts guiding the reader through.
meanings.sent4: His gestures served as punctuations to his passionate speech, emphasizing key points.
meanings.sent5: The lack of punctuations in the letter caused confusion about its intended tone.
